data.text: My friends, listen to what I am going to teach you;
I am going to give you some sayings that wise people have said.
things that we have heard and known previously,
We will tell these things to our children [LIT],
He gave laws and commandments to the Israeli people,
in order that their children would also know them
In that way, they also would trust in God,
They would not be like their ancestors,
The soldiers of the tribe of Ephraim had bows and arrows
They did not do what they had agreed with God that they would do;
They forgot what he had done;
While our ancestors were watching,
Then he caused the Red Sea to divide,
He led them by a bright cloud during the day
He split rocks open in the desert,
He caused a stream of water to flow from the rock;
But our ancestors continued to sin against God;
By demanding that God give them the food that they desired,
They insulted God by saying, “We don’t think he can supply food for us here in this desert!
It is true that he struck the rock,
So, when Yahweh heard that, he became very angry,
He did that because they did not trust in him,
But God spoke to the sky above them;
and then food fell down like rain,
So the people ate the food that angels eat,
Later, he caused the wind to blow from the east,
and the wind brought birds
God caused those birds to fall dead in the middle of ◄their camp►/the area where the people had put up their tents.
So the people cooked the birds and ate the meat and their stomachs were full,
But before they had eaten all that they wanted,
God was still very angry with them,
In spite of all that, the people continued to sin;
So, he caused their lives to end as quickly as a puff of wind ends;
When God caused some of them to die,
They remembered that God is like a huge rock ledge under which they would be safe [MET],
But they tried to deceive God by what they said [MTY];
They were not loyal to him;
But God was merciful to his people.
He remembered/considered that they were only humans who die;
Many times our ancestors rebelled against God in the desert
Many times they did evil things, to find out if they could do those things without God punishing them.
They forgot about his great power,
They forgot about when he performed many miracles
He caused the Nile River (OR, their sources of water) to become red like blood,
He sent among the people of Egypt swarms of flies that bit them,
He sent locusts to eat their crops
He sent hail that destroyed the grapevines,
He sent hail that killed their cattle
Because God was fiercely angry with the people of Egypt,
He did not lessen his being angry with them,
He also caused all the firstborn sons of the people of Egypt to die.
Then he led his people out of Egypt like a shepherd leads his sheep [SIM],
He led them safely, and they were not afraid,
Later he brought them to Canaan, his sacred land,
He expelled the people-groups while his people were advancing;
However, the Israeli people rebelled against God, who is greater than any other god,
Instead, like their ancestors did, they rebelled against God and ◄were not loyal to/did not faithfully obey► him;
Because they worshiped carved images of their gods on the tops of hills,
He saw what they were doing and became very angry,
He no longer appeared to them at Shiloh
He allowed their enemies to capture the sacred chest,
Because he was angry with his people,
Young men were killed in battles,
Many priests were killed by their enemies’ swords,
Later, it was as though the Lord awoke from sleeping;
He pushed their enemies back
But he did not set up his tent where the people of the tribe of Ephraim lived;
Instead he chose the area where the tribe of Judah lived;
He decided to have his temple built there, high up, like his home in heaven;
He chose David, who served him faithfully,
where he was taking care of his father’s sheep,
David took care of the Israeli people sincerely and wholeheartedly,
